Class PooledSegment

java.lang.Object
express.mvp.myra.codec.runtime.PooledSegment
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public final class PooledSegment extends Object implements AutoCloseable
An AutoCloseable wrapper for a MemorySegment that automatically releases the segment back to its pool when used in a try-with-resources block.

Thread Safety

This class is NOT thread-safe for concurrent access to the same instance. Once created, a PooledSegment should be owned by a single thread until it is closed.

However, the class is safe to:

  • Create in one thread and transfer ownership to another (before any access)
  • Close from a different thread than where it was created (single close only)

Important: Do not access the underlying segment after calling close(). The segment is returned to the pool and may be reused by other code.

Example usage: 

try (PooledSegment pooled = new PooledSegment(encoder.acquire(1024), pool)) {
    MemorySegment segment = pooled.segment();
    // ... use segment for encoding ...
} // Segment automatically released back to pool
